result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Adam W. Zipperer

records.addlTxt: Supplement to Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights
Waiver of Right to Personal Appearance.
Plea/sentencing hearing on December 8, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Christin Saint Pierre, for Public Defender.

Defendant Adam W. Zipperer appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Luke K Harrison appeared by video for Adam W. Zipperer.  Prosecuting attorney Angelina R Scarpelli appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense waives reading of the complaint and reserves all other jurisdictional rights and objections. 
Not guilty plea(s).  Jury calendar. 
Offer deadline 11-04-2022

ADDRESS INFO for Adam W. Zipperer
Current: c/o Manitowoc County Jail,   (Effective: 09-20-2022)
Prior: 1000 19Th St, Two Rivers, WI 54241
RE: Possession of Drug Paraphernalia, Repeater on 09-07-2022.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of possession of drug paraphernalia.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 09-29-2022 at 10:30 a.m. in B-15.  Bail is set at $500 recognizance bond with the conditions that he have no contact with Dylan Magle, Andrew Thornton, and Carrie Knapp; with the exception of having third party contact with Carrie Knapp for the purpose of exchanging property at the residence.
Court orders the defendant to report to the Manitowoc County Sheriff's Department for fingerprints, photographs and identifying information within 48 hours or, if incarcerated, within 72 hours of release.  Bail furnished and defendant is remanded into custody on a PO hold. 
Minutes.
